page.title: 06BIDDISHAM CHURCH
page.content: IT IS UNUSUAL TO FIND A CHURCH WHOSE SIZE REFLECTS THE SIZE OF THE COMMUNITY,THIS DOES APPLY TO THE CHURCH OF ST.JOHNS AT BIDDISHAM.IT IS SITED AT THE CENTRE OF THE STRAGGLING VILLAGE ON A ROAD WHICH LEADS NOWHERE. THE CHURCH HAS OBVIOSLY BEEN BUILT IN STAGES, MOSTLY OF LOCAL LIMESTONE.THE LOWER PART OF THE TOWER AND THE CHARCEL ARCH DATE FROM THE THIRTEENTH CENTURY.THE REMAINDER WAS REBUILT IN 1860. THE CHURCH WILL SEAT ABOUT A HUNDRED PEOPLE.THE WALLS ARE WHITE,CONTRASTING WITH THE BROWN WOOD OF THE ROOF. IT IS A PLEASING BUILDING WHICH IS OBVIOSLY WELL USED.
